Player History
Drafted in 3rd round, 46th overall pick, by New Jersey in 1958...
Traded from New Jersey to Gashouse on 4/25/1958 (Going to GHG: 1B G. Holub, P W. Jent. Going to NJ: SS B. Hooey)...
Injured on 7/17/1958 with a Stiff Shoulder, out for one week...
Injured on 4/22/1959 with a Strained Back Muscle, out for 3 weeks...
Released by Gashouse on 5/11/1961...
Signed as a free agent by New Jersey on 3/1/1962 to a minor league contract.
Injured on 5/26/1962 with a Sore Shoulder, out for one week...
Injured on 7/18/1962 with a Sore Shoulder, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 4/7/1963 with a Pulled Tricep Muscle, out for 5-6 weeks...
Injured on 5/25/1963 with a Inflamed Elbow Ligament, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 6/6/1963 with a Torn Bicep Muscle, out for 5-6 weeks...
Injured on 5/12/1965 with a Blister On Finger, out for 6 days...
Released by New Jersey on 5/5/1966...
Drafted in 5th round, 100th overall pick, by Plum Grove in 1967...
Injured on 7/13/1969 with a Broken Nose, out for one week...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/5/1974, off David Maniscalco (Min)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/18/1974, off Robert Upson (NE)...
Injured on 9/23/1975 with a Concussion, out for one week...
Drove in 6 runs against Manchester on 5/28/1976...
